title: Is Spotify a good app for listening to Podcasts? - Quora

response.answer_text: Spotify is definitely a great platform and if I can find the podcasts I listen to, I will most likely listen on Spotify. However, I’ve noticed that while the platform is good, it’s still not used by podcasters at large. The search function in Spotify is also still very difficult to use since it’s very sensitive to what you search for. It will not interpret what you might have meant when searching, but instead give you results on the exact words you put in. The apple podcast application is what I’ve been using since most podcasts will be available there. While I don’t like the interface, it is the best place to most likely find what you’re looking for. The search is much better and will give you results based on the title as well as give you options of podcasts that might be similar to what you searched for.

Heck yeah. We were surprised by a huge majority of people who listen to our podcast listen on Spotify. Spotify beats even Apple Podcasts and iTunes for download numbers for us. I think this is because, unlike Apple, Spotify have actually got some discoverability for new podcasts. Plus, Spotify is cross device and cross platform. Whether you’re on an Apple device or Android, on a phone or desktop computer. Plus, more people listen to music than podcasts so already have and know what Spotify is.
